title: Rectangles
text:
Byteman has a collection of N squares with side 1.
    How many different rectangles can he form using these squares?Two rectangles are considered different if none of them can be rotated
    and moved to obtain the second one.
    During rectangle construction, Byteman can neither deform the squares
    nor put any squares upon any other ones.InputThe first and only line of the standard input contains one
    integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 10000).OutputThe first and only line of the standard output should contain
    a single integer equal to the number of different rectangles
    that Byteman can form using his squares.ExampleFor the input data:6the correct result is:8Task author: Jakub Radoszewski.
